poem:
Title: Amidst the Red Sea Crisis

In the white wake of trade,
lies hijacked— a vessel, heart-tide
by a Red Sea storm, uncaged.
In the cruel reprise: cargo, not caged,
but human. Abraham's coinage,
weighted by a western voyage.
A fear-gleam echoes, a counter-image
yet, the price of peril uncaged:
the militant whisper become a language.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "As the Red Sea crisis continues, pressure on consumer prices follows in its wake When footage first appeared of Houthi rebels hijacking the cargo ship Galaxy Leader in the Red Sea last November, it sent shockwaves through the world of trade. The coordinated attack on the ship, which was partly owned by Israeli billionaire Abraham Ungar, was the start of a six-month campaign by Yemen-based militants to terrorise western vessels using the route, in response". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
